intro: Columnea pilosissima, commonly known as the woolly mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant features velvety, hairy foliage that gives it its common name, and it thrives in shaded, humid environments. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Columnea pilosissima blooms throughout the year under proper conditions, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
